doc:
Jennifer Paterson https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jennifer_Paterson 0 Jennifer Mary Paterson (3 April 1928 – 10 August 1999) was a British celebrity chef, actress and television personality who appeared on the television programme Two Fat Ladies (1996-1999) with Clarissa Dickson Wright. Prior to this, she wrote a cookery column both for The Spectator and for the Oldie.The pair were famous for their rich traditional meals made from scratch. Paterson was known for her liberal use of butter and cream, remarking on her television show in her usual manner with a shake of the hand, that yoghurt was only fit for vegetarians and those with "a poor tummy". They travelled to filming locations throughout the UK on Paterson's Triumph Thunderbird motorbike with Dickson Wright occupying the sidecar. Jennifer_Mary_Paterson ( 3_April_1928 – 10_August_1999 ) was a_British_celebrity_chef , actress_and_television_personality who appeared on the_television_programme_Two_Fat_Ladies ( 1996-1999 ) with Clarissa_Dickson_Wright . Prior to this , she wrote a_cookery_column both for The_Spectator and for the_Oldie.The_pair were famous for their_rich_traditional_meals made from scratch . Paterson was_known for her_liberal_use of butter_and_cream , remarking on her_television_show in her_usual_manner with a_shake of the_hand , that yoghurt was only_fit for vegetarians and those with " a_poor_tummy_" . They travelled to filming_locations throughout the_UK on Paterson 's_Triumph_Thunderbird_motorbike with Dickson_Wright occupying the_sidecar .
